alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:06AM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 PM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
